mxCell.value:
WorldGrid
Spatial manager that owns chunk cache, routes queries through GridPoints, and keeps runtime Assets bound to the grid so updating and rendering can find entities quickly.

chunks_
Map keyed by chunk coordinates holding the active chunk state used to load, unload, and query regions.

points_
Dense GridPoint array covering the same world span so WorldGrid can answer which assets occupy every coordinate.

Chunk
Block of GridPoints plus tile and asset metadata used to stream localized sections of the world.

tiles
Chunk keeps its GridTile definitions here to describe the geometry and lighting of each cell.

assets
Chunk stores the runtime Assets inside its bounds to batch updates, residency checks, and unloading.

GridTile
Static tile descriptor that captures bounds, textures, and lighting for a single grid cell.

world_rect
World-space rectangle used to determine whether the tile sits inside the camera bounds.

texture
Light texture overlay object that paints the tile illumination and blends with the base color.

GridPoint
Shared cell structure that holds world/chunk coordinates, render offsets, and references to occupying Assets.

id
Unique handle for each GridPoint so residency and caching layers can reference it directly.

grid_index
Flat index inside the overall grid array so lookups can be performed with a single pointer.

chunk_index
Index linking the point back to its owning chunk for chunk-level invalidation or streaming.

world
World-space coordinate pair that locates this GridPoint inside the scene.

chunk
Chunk identifier or pointer letting the GridPoint know which chunk contains it.

screen
Latest screen-space data used by the renderer to draw assets anchored to this grid point.

parallax_dx
Horizontal offset used to nudge assets for parallax layers when the camera moves.

tilt_radians
Tilt value applied when simulating perspective so the point distorts correctly.

perspective_scale
Scale factor used to shrink or enlarge attached assets based on distance or perspective.

horizon_fade_alpha
Alpha value applied when the point nears the horizon to fade assets gracefully.

distance_to_camera
Cached distance metric so rendering and shading can adjust level of detail.

vertical_scale
Vertical stretch factor that adjusts assets when the camera tilts up or down.

on_screen
Flag indicating whether the cell is inside the camera view.

screen_data_frame_updated
Frame counter noting if the screen layout data has been recomputed this update.

screen_data_valid
Boolean that confirms the cached screen data can be used instead of forcing a rebuild.

Asset
Runtime object that carries position, animation, render caches, controller, and child references so the engine can update and draw it.

spawn_fields
Spawn metadata that tells the asset what slots or triggers to use when it is instantiated.

pointer_fields
Pointers the asset keeps to controllers, timers, or external references required during updates.

state_fields
Stateful data such as flags, counters, or timers that tracks what the asset is doing currently.

cached_grid_residency_
Cache of the set of grid points and chunks the asset has touched for quicker residency checks.

smoothing_states
Smoothing data used to interpolate motion or state transitions across frames.

anim_runtime_
Runtime animation data that tracks which animation is playing and its progress.

current_frame
Pointer to the animation frame currently displayed for this asset.

frame_progress
Progress metric between animation frames used to interpolate motion.

animation_children_
List of animation-driven child attachments that follow the parent asset.

render_package
Prepared render resources such as textures, masks, and geometry that the renderer pulls per frame.

mask_render_metadata_
Metadata for mask drawing so shadow and lighting passes can reuse computed masks.

tiling_info_
Info about how this asset tiles across the grid, including origins and coverage.

shadow_mask_cache_
Cached shadow textures this asset uses when lighting or occlusion conditions remain stable.

cast_shadow_cache_
Cache of the shadow silhouettes cast by the asset for reuse by the light system.

asset_children
Explicit child asset instances owned by this asset for layered graphics or composite entities.

controller_
Reference to the controller that drives input, AI, or scripted behavior for the asset.

neighbors
Nearby GridPoint handles the asset can query for collision, pathing, or spread effects.

impassable_neighbors
Subset of neighbors that block traversal so movement logic can respect obstacles.

angle_from_camera
Angular difference between the camera and the asset used to tweak shading or occlusion.

last_scale_usage_
Cache of the last scale pulled from AssetInfo so the asset knows when to refresh visuals.

scale_variant_state_
Current scale variant applied to the asset, guiding which textures or transforms to use.

grid_id_
Identifier tying the asset back to the grid cell for quick residency lookups.

anim_
Reference to the current animation definition the asset is playing.

AnimationChildAttachment
Links child assets to their parent with offsets and timing information for animation-driven setups.

child_index
Index identifying which attachment slot this child occupies.

asset_name
Name of the child asset that will be spawned or controlled.

animation_ref
Pointer to the animation resource the child should follow.

current_frame_ref
Reference to the child current frame so it stays in sync with the parent.

world_pos
World-space offset applied when the child is attached to the parent.

visible
Flag indicating whether the child should be rendered.

spawned_asset
Runtime asset handle representing the actual spawned child.

timeline
Timing data that dictates when the child appears, disappears, or updates.

RenderObject
Structure produced by the Asset before handing data to the renderer, capturing geometry, masks, and blend settings.

screen_rect
Screen-space rectangle used for clipping and visibility checks.

color_mod
Color tint applied to the rendered object.

blend_mode
Blend mode controlling how the object composites with others.

last_mask_texture
Most recent mask texture so the renderer can reuse it until inputs change.

mask_defaults
Fallback mask parameters used when the asset does not provide a custom mask.

base_defaults
Default rendering settings used until richer data becomes available.

TilingInfo
Data describing how tiling is laid out so assets can snap to the grid.

grid_origin
Origin coordinate for the tiling pattern.

tile_size
Dimensions used when tiling textures or aligning assets.

coverage
Coverage ratios describing how much of the grid is filled.

anchor
Anchor point used when aligning tiles to a grid origin.

AssetInfo
Data record describing asset animations, tags, lighting, and spawn rules so the runtime can configure each Asset.

animations
List of available Animation definitions for this AssetInfo.

animation_children
Child definitions that follow specific animations.

async_children
Definitions for children that start or stop asynchronously.

scale_factor
Base scale applied to Assets using this info when no variant overrides exist.

smooth_scaling
Flag enabling interpolation whenever the asset scale changes.

scale_variants
Alternative scale bundles the runtime can swap in for different contexts.

tillable
Flag that indicates whether the asset can tile horizontally or vertically.

z_threshold
Threshold controlling when the asset renders in front or behind other elements.

flipable
Flag that marks whether the asset can flip horizontally.

apply_distance_scaling
Enables automatic scaling based on distance to the camera.

apply_vertical_scaling
Enables scaling adjustments driven by vertical offsets.

is_shaded
Controls whether the AssetInfo participates in shading passes.

shadow_mask_settings
Settings that configure how this asset casts or receives shadow masks.

shading_parallax_amount
Parallax multiplier used during shading to create depth.

shading_screen_brightness_multiplier
Brightness multiplier applied to the screen-space shading result.

shading_opacity_multiplier
Opacity multiplier that darkens or lightens shading overlays.

light_sources
Local light sources tied to the asset for self-illumination or effects.

name
Canonical name used for lookups and tooling.

type
General type or category tag that drives logic branches.

custom_controller_key
Key that maps to custom controller collections.

tags
Positive tags used to find this AssetInfo when spawning or filtering content.

anti_tags
Negative tags preventing this asset from appearing in incompatible contexts.

areas
Named areas where this asset can spawn or operate.

preview_texture
Texture used in editors or previews to represent the asset.

Animation
Defines a sequence of frames and optional audio that assets can play.

frames
Ordered AnimationFrame entries the runtime cycles through.

audio_data
Attached audio cues that play when the animation is active.

source
Source data or file path that contains the animation frames.

frame_cache_
Cache structure storing rendered frames for reuse.

AnimationFrame
Single frame definition within an animation, including variants and child data.

variants
List of variant textures or geometry for this frame.

hit_geometry
Geometry used for hit detection while this frame is playing.

attack_geometry
Geometry marking where attacks or damage should originate from.

children
Child frame or asset definitions that activate during this frame.

FrameVariant
Variant package that swaps textures, masks, and paths per animation frame.

varient
Identifier used to choose this variant set.

base_texture
Primary texture for this variant.

foreground_texture
Foreground overlay texture applied while this variant is active.

background_texture
Background overlay texture applied while this variant is active.

shadow_mask_texture
Shadow mask texture used for the variant.

path
Path or asset identifier where the variant textures come from.

volume
Volume level for any sound tied to this variant.

kind
Category or intent label for this variant such as idle or attack.

FrameCache
Stores rendered textures for animation frames so they can be reused without re-creating GPU resources.

textures
Cached textures for the frame cache.

foreground_textures
Cached foreground overlays.

background_textures
Cached background overlays.

mask_textures
Cached mask textures used during shading.

AsyncChildDefinition
Definition for a child asset that activates asynchronously.

asset
AssetInfo reference that describes the async child.

animation
Animation reference the async child will play.

ChildInfo
Details describing how a child asset should align or offset.

area_name
Name of the area the child should remain in.

z_offset
Vertical offset applied while rendering the child.

spawn_group
Spawn configuration block controlling how groups of assets spread across the map.

expansion_ratio
Ratio the group uses to grow spawn radius as assets spawn.

blur_scale
Softness factor controlling how the spawn group distributes assets.

falloff_start
Distance where spawn density begins to taper.

falloff_exponent
Exponent applied to sharpen or flatten density falloff.

alpha_multiplier
Multiplier applied to spawn opacity or strength.

LightSource
Light definition used to shade assets and grid points.

intensity
Brightness value of the light.

radius
Radius over which the light affects assets.

fall_off
Curve value describing how the light dims with distance.

color
RGB color of the light.

flicker_speed
Speed at which the light twinkles or flickers.

in_front
Flag saying whether the light renders in front of geometry.

render_to_dark_mask
Flag indicating whether this light writes to the darkness mask.

NamedArea
Named region that spawn data or animations can reference.

area
Geometry or tag that defines the named region.

render_frame
Render frame used for previewing the area.

RENDERER
Visual label denoting the renderer section of the diagram.

Background color
Label that highlights where the renderer background color is controlled.

main
Entry point that wires grid management, assets, and rendering into the runtime loop.

Loading Pipeline
Pre-runtime steps that prepare assets, textures, and rooms before handing control to the runtime loop.

File Discovery
Scan content roots, SRC/assets directories, and manifest-specified folders to collect asset, audio, lighting, and spawn resources before parsing data.

Manifest Read
Read the manifest, resolve the requested map entry or fallback descriptor, normalize the content_root, and capture layers, trails, spawn, and lighting metadata for the map.

Cache Check
Check cache/ for prebuilt textures and light masks named by the manifest so unchanged resources can be reused before triggering rebuilds.

Python Texture Gen
Run asset_tool.py, light_tool.py, or other Python pipelines to rebuild textures, masks, or animation variants when manifest flags request it.

Asset Metadata Build
AssetLibrary syncs manifest entries with SRC/assets, builds AssetInfo records covering animation, lighting, controller, and spawn hints, and warms cached animation data.

Asset Load
AssetLoader deserializes asset instances from room and spawn data, attaches AssetInfo references, warms animation/light metadata, finalizes each asset, and readies them for registration with the world grid.

Room/Trail Generation
Generate rooms, trails, boundaries, named areas, spawn groups, and grid settings from map data, with a fallback spawn room when needed.

Spawn Planner
AssetSpawnPlanner merges spawn_groups across manifest, rooms, and trails, assigns spawn IDs/priorities, resolves tag-based candidates, and scales quantities to room size.

Spawn Executor
AssetSpawner runs the queue through exact/center/random/perimeter/percent/edge spawners, handles zone assets, child attachments, and boundary passes to build `Asset` instances in rooms.

Engine Handoff
Pass curated rooms, spawn assets, world grid chunks, map settings, and the AssetLibrary into the bootstrap that creates the runtime `Assets` manager.

Runtime Bootstrap
Assets, SceneRenderer, and InitializeAssets wire the camera, world grid, and active assets before handing control to main's game loop.

Runtime Architecture
High-level runtime overview of the engine subsystems and data flow.

Color Key
World / spatial grid
Assets & animation runtime
Asset definitions
Rendering / renderer
Lighting
Spawn / areas

Render Process
Horizontal flow outlining how the renderer builds each frame from start to presentation.

Frame Start
Collect delta time, input, camera, and chunk updates before drawing begins.

Clear & Setup
Clear buffers, recompute camera transforms, and prepare lighting/compositor state.

Background & Depth
Clear depth, draw the sky layer and parallax backgrounds, then render static chunk tiles through GridTileRenderer to prime depth before assets are drawn.

Asset Render Packages
Bundle each asset's textures, masks, lighting hints, and child layers for batching.

Asset Draw & Masks
SceneRenderer iterates active assets, applies transforms, draws each render_package entry with SDL_RenderCopy, and records scene_mask_lights for later darkness compositing.

Lighting & Composite
Sort packages, apply shading and lighting masks while collecting scene_mask_lights, blend them respecting depth, and prepare dark mask sprites for render_dynamic_darkness_overlay.

Post & Present
Apply render_dynamic_darkness_overlay, run blur and post effects, and call SDL_RenderPresent to swap buffers for the final frame.

Asset Loader
pipe for managing the map gen room and trail gen and spawning.
